results.title: Mars attacks! [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Larry Franco and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Science fiction and cult movie fans will warm to Tim Burton’s distinct brand of humour in this sci-fi spoof where, once again, Earth is invaded by martians. These mean green invaders from the Red Planet have slimey humungous brains, are armed with Instr-ray guns, and are cinematically supported by state-of-the-art special effects. The stars that shine here include Jack Nicholson (in a dual role), Glenn Close, Annette Bening, Pierce Brosnan, Danny DeVito, plus many more notable cameos (including one by Tom Jones).

results.title: Mars attacks the world
results.creator_credit: Robert F Hill, Ford Beebe, Barney A Sarecky and Filmcraft Production
results.brief_description: Based on Alex Raymond’s newspaper feature “Flash Gordon” and the serial “Flash Gordon’s trip to Mars”, this condensed version of the serial provides a fascinating historical look into the sci-fi films of the past, minus all the special effects and computer animation of today’s blockbuster sci-fi films. The story revolves around the universal theme of good vs evil, of enemy planets trying to destroy Earth. When strange unexplained phenomena start occuring on Earth, Flash Gordon (Larry “Buster” Crabbe), Dr Zarkov (Frank Shannon) and Dale Arden (Jean Rogers) jump to the rescue and take a space flight to Mars, crash-landing in the Valley of Desolation. There Flash runs into his old enemy Ming the Merciless of Planet Mongo, and Ming’s ally, Queen Azura of Mars, whose attempts to destroy Earth with a deadly ray are eventually thwarted by Flash and his companions with the help of The Clay King and his Clay Men. Flash, Dale and Dr Zarkov return to Earth to a hero’s welcome, ticker-tape parade and all. Cast also includes Charles Middleton, Beatrice Roberts, Donald Kerr, Richard Alexander. NB: “Due to unique material contained herein, fluctuations may occur in picture and sound quality.”

results.title: Married to the mob
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Edward Saxon, Kenneth Utt, Mysterious Arts and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: This comedy from director Jonathan Demme (Philadelphia, Beloved, Something wild, The Silence of the lambs) is a spoof on the mobster/gangster genre. Angela DeMarco is unhappily married to Frank, a low-level mafia operator, and is tired of the mob-life with all the trappings. When Frank dies in mysterious circumstances, Angela decides to start a new life, as far from the mob as she can manage. Unbeknownst to Angela, an FBI agent is trailing her in order to get the dirt on Tony. Complications ensue when the agent following Angela, falls for her instead. Demme keeps the tone light throughout with caricatures of New York mob types, in particular the women with over the top hair and a gaudy aesthetic. Modine does well playing to the stereotype of the uncool, bumbling FBI agent. Cast includes: Michelle Pfeiffer, Dean Stockwell, Matthew Modine, Nancy Travis, Mercedes Ruehl, Joan Cusack, Oliver Platt, Chris Isaak and Alec Baldwin. Music by David Byrne of Talking Heads.

results.title: Married life (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part One of the series “The Family of Man”’ which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. In a comparison of marriages, with men and women sometimes having several partners, this program sets out to discover what, if anything, these marriages have in common. Husbands and wives, shown going about their daily lives are interviewed.

results.title: Married Life
results.creator_credit: V. G. Jones, C.J. Andrews and London Filmmaker's Co-op
results.brief_description: A naturalistic approach to experimental film making. The filmmakers have taken one script and interpreted it in four different ways.

results.title: Marrickville
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Russ Hermann and Jotz Productions
results.brief_description: The inner-city Sydney suburb of Marrickville is the most ethnically diverse locality in Australia. The suburb’s heavy industry goes back to the mid-19th century and successive generations of migrants have settled and worked in the area. The video celebrates the contribution of Greeks, Yugoslavs and Turks to Sydney, from the post-WWII years to the present, as well as looking at the experiences of more recent migrants from war-torn Lebanon and Vietnam. Through the poetry and prose of migrant Australians and that of their children we hear of the cultural dislocation experienced by residents of Marrickville.

results.title: Marriage under stress: Put asunder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
The man, the woman - and the children - of broken marriages. Second-hand people? Or is it just the way everyone else treats them? What happens when a marriage is finally over? Who suffers most? And what chance of a new life is there for men and women who have been “put asunder?” Today more marriages than ever end in divorce courts but the bitterness does not always stop with divorce, and children sometimes become the ammunition between parted parents.

results.title: Marriage under stress: children make the difference
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Discusses factors which contribute to the break-up of marriages. Millions of married couples see bringing up children as fulfilling as worthwhile. While for others the first real stress of marriage comes with the arrival of children.

results.title: Marriage under stress: Breaking point
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
What are the pressures that bring a marriage to the brink of disaster, that force a couple to consider a future apart from each other? Its is not always “The other woman” and it does not necessarily happen in the seventh year of marriage. This programme examines marriages which are pivoted between break-up and recovery.
